msItem.title: A translation of the Dhakhirat al-Iskandar.
msItem.note: Bound and uniform with Ellis 11 (2) and 11 (3). By the same scribe. F1a. Signature of A.G. Ellis. A work in ten sections (fann) on various aspects of magic, supposedly translated (into Arabic) from a Greek original. This version lacks the usual story of the discovery of the bookduring al-Mu'tasim's siege of Amorium in A.D. 838.. Headings in red. Contains several illustrations of inscriptions for talismans and a few blank spaces intended for others.
msItem.incipit: Wa in ast awwal-i kitab-i mutarjam

listBibl.bibl: Manfred Ullmann, Die Natur- und Geheimwissenschaften im Islam, pp. 376-7.

bindingDesc.p: Red leather Indian binding with silver-tooled decoration.

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
